snippet: Many big events now happen later in adulthood, so it is not too surprising that saving for retirement is increasingly put off. But for people on the cusp of 40, it is time to do something.
abstract: Financial experts say there are a variety of ways for people between the ages of 34 to 49 to save a considerable amount for retirement if they have not already begun to do so.
lead_paragraph: Many big events now happen later in adulthood, so it is not too surprising that saving for retirement is increasingly put off. But for people on the cusp of 40, it is time to do something.

headline.main: Playing Catch-Up While Retirement Remains Far Off
headline.print_headline: Playing Catch-Up While Retirement Remains Far Off
